column4: Hey, I have a livecd problem.  I have a known good 32bit livecd and when I try to run it on a dell latitude d820 I get Kernel Panic -- not syncing: VFS: Unable to mount root fs on unknown-block(0,0)
its a hdd problem
When I'm running a known good livecd?  Does that mean I should try booting off an external cd drive?
ive seen that issue with hackintosh systems
cannot load hdd hardware info
if you can, try another sata port, or another hd
as in, the VFS it's trying to create in memory, right?
as in, it cant access the hardware
so if I disconnect the hdd, it should boot fine?  It looks like it's having trouble making the vfs in memory.
or are you saying it can't access the vfs image on the disk?
how old is your hardware?
Just a few years.  It's a latitude with a gig of memory and a core duo processor.
hello?  Is that spectacularly old?
I thought as long as I had a gig of memory the new livecds would work?
its a hard drive issue
not a memmory
memory
since it's live, it won't touch the hard drive unless I want it to.  So it's either memory or disk...
its probing your hardware
try removing the hard drive
Ok, thanks.
